instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2641: What is 820-2641? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2641</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot LED 1 Blinks
threads.message:
Board does not boot and LED 1 only blink.

<SIGNAL>PP12V_G3H</SIGNAL> - 12V
<SIGNAL>PP12V_S5</SIGNAL> = 12v
pp3v42 - 3.41 
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 4.9
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 0
<SIGNAL>PM_EN_P3V3_S5_REG</SIGNAL> = 3.8v constant.

Tried replacing <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> - same, but i replaced with ISL62383C same outcome.

i removed <RESISTOR>R7776</RESISTOR>  to cut <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> from load, i get still get 3.3 for split second.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2641</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot LED 1 Blinks
threads.message:
Post basic voltages for <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>; pins 17, 18, 4, 5, 12.
Change it with normal <CHIP>ISL62383</CHIP>, not with "C" suffix.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2641</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot LED 1 Blinks
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2641</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot LED 1 Blinks
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> should appear.
If not, check all related resistors and traces; pay atention to <RESISTOR>R7710</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7714</CAPACITOR>.
Also check diode mode to ground at L7710.
Be sure to use correct <CHIP>ISL62383</CHIP> version.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2641</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot LED 1 Blinks
threads.message: i have replaced with ILS62383 version and i still get the same spike in the beginning and no voltage after that.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2641</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot LED 1 Blinks
threads.message: Check all traces, solders and components around <CHIP>ISL62383</CHIP> chip.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2641</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot LED 1 Blinks
threads.message:
have double checked and triple checked, replaced another <CHIP>ISL62383</CHIP> for good measure and still get the same results.
removed all resisters connected to the ISL and measured them individually, 

this should be a closed circuit. this is gonna keep me awake for days trying to solve

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2641</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot LED 1 Blinks
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2641</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot LED 1 Blinks
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2641</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot LED 1 Blinks
threads.message:
So <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> has correct power and enable.
Did you check <CAPACITOR>C7756</CAPACITOR> and traces?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2641</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot LED 1 Blinks
threads.message:
Yes i have checked on p5vs3 lines as well and they are all within spec. i have injected 3.3v to <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> as well as 5v to <SIGNAL>PP5V_3</SIGNAL> and both don't show shorts and have current draw less than 100ma 
the only thing have not looked at is <TRANSISTOR>Q7110</TRANSISTOR>. measurements all looks good, gonna order some parts and try to replace then

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2641</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot LED 1 Blinks
threads.message:
so, i replaced all the resisters for the ISL(<RESISTOR>R7720</RESISTOR>,7721,7724,7790,7791) and <TRANSISTOR>Q7110</TRANSISTOR> and still get the same results. <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> just blinks once and dead. Measured Pgood(pin8) never had any output which means ISL is in protection mode. but no idea what protection.

for good measure i injected 3.3v on pin 24 and i get a nice 5v out for <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>. so the ISL chip is good.
i spent too much time on this board. any last ideas before i throw in the towel?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2641</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot LED 1 Blinks
threads.message: If you force enable signal for <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>, does it stay on too?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2641</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot LED 1 Blinks
threads.message: En signal for <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is already high @3.8v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2641</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot LED 1 Blinks
threads.message: Remove <RESISTOR>R7775</RESISTOR> and check if get steady 3.3V at <CAPACITOR>C7761</CAPACITOR>.
